intro: Ronnowia, commonly known as the Ronnowia genus, is a group of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their alternate, simple leaves and showy flowers. The flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and can be either bisexual or unisexual. Ronnowia species are native to tropical and subtropical regions, often found in moist, well-drained soils. They are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their vibrant blooms.
